reference.shortdesc: A navigation title is an alternative title for a resource. It is designed for situations where the topic title is unsuitable for use in a table of contents or navigation pane.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The navtitle element is a convenience element. It is equivalent to a titlealt element with title-role set to navigation.

div.p: Processing expectations are dictated by the rules for the titlealt element.
In some cases, when processing a topicref element that has no href attribute, the navigation title can also be used as the title of the generated topic, if applicable.

section.title: Attributes

div.p: The following attributes are available on this element: and title-role.
For this element, title-role has a default value of navigation.

section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , class, and outputclass.
